intro: Trichera drymeja subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate Trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
